isis.stitle: 530 and DT-466/408 Diesel Engine Diagnostics (1993) - DIAGNOSTIC ANALYSIS - DIAGNOSTIC ANALYSIS PROCEDURES FOR.. - ...COMBUSTION LEAKAGE TEST

step1.para: Inspect the deaeration tank (pressure) cap gasket and the deaeration tank filler neck seat for damage to insure that leakage will not occur.
Check the overflow pipe for damage.
Fill the coolant deaeration tank to the top of the filler neck which is beyond the normal fill capacity.
With the engine at operating temperature, operating at low idle speed, the thermostat fully opened and the cooling system purged of air, fill the test bucket and pop bottle with water.
Immerse the filled pop bottle in the bucket of water with the filler neck facing the bottom of the bucket as shown in Fig. 2.1.

figure.caption: Figure 2.1 Combustion Leakage Test and Connections

step1.para: Insert the overflow line extension into the bottle neck.
Observe the pop bottle for aeration (bubbles or in extreme cases the water in the pop bottle will be blown out).

note.para: Bubbles or expulsion of water from bottle indicate head gasket or nozzle sleeve leakage or a cracked or porous cylinder head.
